discourse_list.title: How about hacking Discourse to reduce noise and increase signal?

content.content: TL;DR: how about we add a bit of formatting to original posts to make everyone’s life a lot easier? As a former Software Developer, I’m a huge fan of StackOverflow (c.f. my profile). It organically grew to become the biggest platform for devs to help each other out, and even became StackExchange who supports dozen of “StackOverflow clones” across almost any topic. Its advanced moderation features allowed to reduce noise and increase signal to an extent that it makes finding almost anything super easy: duplicates removal, advanced moderation levels, questions reviews, answers reviews, etc. Event though Jeff Atwood is both cofounder at StackOverflow and Discourse, the later still kinda sucks at basic things such as linking up relevant threads and providing any kind of clear flagging for highly valuable inputs and contributors (in comparison to StackOverflow). The result is that (i) the forum is totally flooded with tons of content, opinions and debates that are actually duplicate of previously addressed points and (ii) one often ends up reading a whole thread when a simple summary at the top would often be enough. How about we consider hacking these issues by simply asking Original Posters to try (i) to update their post with relevant threads they come across afterwards and “cherry on top” (ii) a summary of the whole thread in the Original Post itself? p.s. I’m trying to do this in this thread where I’m the OP
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes to add formatting to original posts in Discourse to reduce noise and increase signal. The author compares Discourse to StackOverflow and suggests that Discourse lacks advanced moderation features, resulting in duplicate content and debates. The author proposes that Original Posters update their posts with relevant threads and a summary of the whole thread. The author is currently trying to implement this proposal in a thread.
